description:
Password manager shouldn't have a default button.

Closing this overlay on enter doesn't make sense, so removed
the default-button class on the 'Done' button.

BUG=254322

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=209270

messages.text: why doesn't it make sense to close on enter?  i don't have any saved passwords nor a screenshot/good explanation... :(

On 2013/06/28 00:16:05, Dan Beam wrote:
> why doesn't it make sense to close on enter?  i don't have any saved passwords
> nor a screenshot/good explanation... :(

Attached a screenshot in the bug. There's nothing in there to focus except buttons, and a search box. Since enter shouldn't go to the default button in any of those cases it makes more sense to not have a default button in my opinion. There's always escape to get out of the overview anyway.
so an enter while in the search box and an enter on an X (to delete an entry) will still work?

On 2013/06/28 00:42:52, Dan Beam wrote:
> so an enter while in the search box and an enter on an X (to delete an entry)
> will still work?

Hitting enter in the search box does nothing (it updates the rest of the view on change). Enter on the X or on the show button activates the buttons as expected, both before and after this CL.
great, thanks for the explanations, lgtm
